title: How to fully edit my 40,000 words novel and publish it with best results - Quora

response.answer_text: As others have stated. 40k word count is barely a novel but it makes a decently short novella. Most of not all professional editors take between 10-15k words out of a true book which is closer to 80-100k. So in editing your novella it would be decimated by such a cut and it would get pruned quite heavily. A publishing house wouldn't even examine it unless they were in the market for a short story and after editing it would be puny. So sorry write a much longer story before calling it a novel 80,000 or higher is generally novel sized books.

I would strongly urge you to hire a professional editor. Even so, at the end of such a process I wonder at the likelihood of success at publishing it. Unless it is aimed at mid-grade audiences, 40,000 words is very short for a novel. I suspect every publisher will dismiss your work without examining it because of the word count. Writer’s Digest offers a simplistic graph on word count - Word Count for Novels and Children's Books: The Definitive Post
